result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Christopher Gordon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Jonathan Christopher Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Defense will not be proceeding with a plea hearing and request dates for final pretrial and jury trial be set.  Court sets the deadline of 1/9/2023 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms and deadline of 11/16/2022 for filing any motions. Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing.  Matter adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Jonathan Christopher Gordon.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pretrial conference.  State will be submitting an amended offer to the defense. Additional time requested to allow further negotiations. Request granted and matter set for Projected Guilty Plea hearing. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Pretrial conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests additional time.  Court grants request and sets this for adjourned Pretrial Conference.
Counsel to advise if Defendant needs to be produced for the next hearing. Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses letter filed by Defendant. Discussion held as to discovery issues brought forth by defendant. Court extends deadline for filing motions or change of plea forms to 08/08/2022. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court will address the letter filed by the defendant on 6/17/2022 at the next hearing on 06/30/2022.
Letter From Defendant ( Jonathan Gordon # 2022000737 - Milwaukee County Jail 949 N 9th St,  Milwaukee, WI 53233)

Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Court amends conditions to include: Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Drug and alcohol testing monitored by JusticePoint. No operation of a motor vehicle during the duration of the case. No possession of firearms, ammunition or magazines. Defendant can not be present in an automobile with a firearm present. Defendant has a 24 HOUR curfew with the exception of medical appointments, legal appointments and on Mondays from 8:00 am to 12:00 pm for the defendant to go to grocery stores and/or pharmacies.

Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan Christopher Gordon appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court set the following filing deadlines. State has until June 10th, 2022, to submit any discovery to defense, except for crime lab reports. Defense has until June 29th, 2022, to file any motions or change of plea forms. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

.Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in custody.   BOTH BY VIDEO.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Alexander Verreault.      Court took judicial notice of case 16CF387. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defense requests an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:03 pm.

Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan Christopher Gordon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  State's witness appeared by zoom.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests additional time to meet with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Jonathan Christopher Gordon in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan Christopher Gordon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
